titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Lelah Jackson Edson scrapbooks 1940-1959
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by CPNWS staff

publicationstmt.publisher: Western Washington University, Center for Pacific Northwest Studies

profiledesc.creation: Finding aid encoded by Rozlind Koester 2012
profiledesc.descrules: Finding aid based on DACS ( Describing Archives: A Content Standard).

did.abstract: These scrapbooks contain newpaper clippings documenting the December 7, 1941 bombing of Pearl Harbor and subsequent events through June 27, 1942. There is also a scrapbook containing clippings about Edson as well as some of her writings that were published in newspapers throughout the area.

scopecontent.p: These scrapbooks contain newpaper clippings documenting the December 7, 1941 bombing of Pearl Harbor and subsequent events through June 27, 1942. The clippings are mostly from the Bellingham Herald but there are also some Seattle newspapers. There is also a scrapbook containing clippings about Edson as well as some of her writings that were published in newspapers throughout the area.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open to the public.

prefercite.p: Lelah Jackson Edson scrapbooks, Center for Pacific Northwest Studies, Western Libraries Archives & Special Collections, Western Washington University, Bellingham WA 98225-9123.

processinfo.head: About Harmful Language and Content
processinfo.p: To learn more about problematic content in our collections, collection description and teaching tools (including how to provide feedback or request dialogue on this topic), see the following Statement About Potentially Harmful Language and Content

controlaccess.p: This collection is indexed under the following headings in the online catalog. Researchers desiring materials about related topics, persons, or places should search the catalog using these headings.
